critique: This executive order establishes the order of succession for the office of Attorney General. It is a fairly procedural document that does not directly address issues of ideological tilt, immigration, economic regulation, or social inclusion. It primarily concerns the functioning of the executive branch and the line of succession within the Department of Justice. The order revokes a previous executive order on the same topic, suggesting an adjustment to the line of succession. The inclusion of exceptions and the disclaimer in Section 4 further emphasize the procedural and non-ideological nature of the document.
